dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.page

Class AbstractPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
      • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.page.AbstractPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMultiPage, XFormPage

    public abstract class AbstractPage
extends dreisoft.tresos.lib2.platform.AbstractExecutableExtension
    An AbstractPage represents a tab or page in a Guided Configuration editor or widget. If the wizard is a single page wizard this class must be implemented by the GUI, if the wizard is a multi page wizard AbstractMultiPage must be implemented. The page like the AbstractBackend is registered via the wizard extension-point dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.plugin.guidedconfigwizard.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

        Returns:
        The id (never null)
        Since:

      • getResourceURL

        public java.net.URL getResourceURL(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Resources like icons, css files for websites etc. can be resolved via this method.

        Each wizard has a base path for resources that can be set via the plugin.xml when registering the widget. This method allows to resolve paths relative to this base path.

        Parameters:
        relativePath - path relative to the basePath that references a resource
        Returns:
        the URL to the requested resource
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getResourceFile

        public java.io.File getResourceFile(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Resources like icons, css files for websites etc. can be resolved via this method.

        Each wizard has a base path for resources that can be set via the plugin.xml when registering the widget. This method allows to resolve paths relative to this base path.

        This method only works if the plug-in that stores the resources is not packed as a jar file.

        Parameters:
        relativePath - path relative to the basePath that references a resource
        Returns:
        the URL to the requested resource
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getImage

        public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getImage(java.lang.String imagePath)
                                        throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException
        Load images or icons.

        The method uses the resource base path getResourceBasePath() to resolve the path to the image.

        Parameters:
        imagePath - relative path to the image
        Returns:
        the image or null if the image cannot be loaded
        Throws:
        dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException - in case the image cannot be found
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getResourceBasePath

        public java.lang.String getResourceBasePath()
        The base path where resources like icons etc are searched.
        Returns:
        the base path relative to the plug-in returned by getResourcePlugIn()
        Since:
        2009.a

        the plug-in, maybe null.

                         throws dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.internal.GuidedConfigException

        Parameters:

      • setNextButtonEnable

        public void setNextButtonEnable(boolean enable)
        Change the enablement of the Next button for multi pages opened as dialog. Calls setNextButtonEnable(boolean) on the corresponding multi page for sub pages, does nothing for single pages. Updating the Gui-buttons is not directly done when calling this method. It is done
        • after opening the page
        • after each page change
        • and after validating
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the button
        Since:
        10

      • isNextButtonEnabled

        public boolean isNextButtonEnabled()
        Checks, if the Next button is enabled for multi pages opened as dialog. Checks the Next button status of the corresponding multi page for sub pages, does nothing for single pages.
        This only checks the status set by the user, it does not take into account if there actually is a next page.
        Returns:
        true if the button is enabled, false if not
        Since:
        10

      • setPreviousButtonEnable

        public void setPreviousButtonEnable(boolean enable)
        Change the enablement of the Previous button for multi pages opened as dialog. Calls setPreviousButtonEnable(boolean) on the corresponding multi page for sub pages, does nothing for single pages. Updating the Gui-buttons is not directly done when calling this method. It is done
        • after opening the page
        • after each page change
        • and after validating
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the button
        Since:
        10

      • isPreviousButtonEnabled

        public boolean isPreviousButtonEnabled()
        Checks, if the Previous button is enabled for multi pages opened as dialog. Checks the Previous button status of the corresponding multi page for sub pages, does nothing for single pages.
        This only checks the status set by the user, it does not take into account if there actually is a previous page.
        Returns:
        true if the button is enabled, false if not (default is true).
        Since:
        10

      • resetPreviousNextButtonEnablement

        @Deprecated
public void resetPreviousNextButtonEnablement()
        Deprecated. 
        For internal use only. Reset the enablement of the Previous and Next buttons in multi page dialogs to default. The default setting is true for both buttons.
        Since:
        10
